message.content:
cs.LO, cs.PL, cs.TL, cs.FL, cs.SE

This paper deals with termination analysis of higher-order rewrite systems (HRSs), which are a computational model of functional programs. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science), which deals with formal methods for reasoning about programs and systems. The paper also mentions the inclusion of lambda-abstraction in HRSs, which suggests that it may also be relevant to cs.PL (Programming Languages), which deals with the study of programming languages and their semantics. Additionally, the paper discusses the static dependency pair method, which is a technique for proving termination in rewrite systems, suggesting that it may also be relevant to cs.TL (Automated Reasoning and Theorem Proving) and cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory). Finally, the paper discusses the application of the static dependency pair method to HRSs without new restrictions, suggesting that it may also be relevant to cs.SE (Software Engineering), which deals with the development and maintenance of software systems.
